main.name: Dan Shrout
main.description: I am a Full Stack Web Developer and primarily use react and nodejs to develop web apps
main.contactmessage: Contact form is under construction. Please use my contact info to contact me!

education.description: Intensive Coding Bootcamp: I took the intensive, 3-month Actualize bootcamp, where I learned Ruby, Rails, JavaScript, VueJS, and more. But most importantly, I learned how to think as a software engineer and gained the ability to tackle any new technology.
Learning everything computer science related including: full stack react development, computer science, web development, algorithms, datastructures, and much more.

work.title: Full Stack Web and Wordpress Developer
work.description: Currently maintaining WordPress sites. Built and shipped multiple websites using HTML, CSS, PHP, SQL, Bootstrap, jQuery and Javascript. Hosted sites on cPanel.

work.title: Android Developer
work.description: Redesigned entire frontend. Added dimensions to XML files to fit screen sizes across all devices. Replaced existing buttons with material design icons.

work.title: Lead Android Developer
work.description: Solely built and shipped an employee management platform for a local business with Android Studio. Designed to look and function identical to the iOS app using Java and XML. Authenticated users, stored user data using Firebase.

work.title: Ruby on Rails Developer
work.description: Worked with a software development team in an agile environment. Personally added features to the real CRM that Actualize uses to manage its prospective applicants. The CRM allows a user to call and text a lead through the Twilio API. Also, worked on features involving its UI, including an internal restructuring that transformed the app into a Single Page Application, making it much easier to use.

projects.title: New Threads Clothing
projects.category: An E-Commerce site built with React, Node.js and Redux

projects.title: Food App
projects.category: An app to save favorite restaurants and recipes built with Ruby on Rails and Vue.js
